meanings.definition: To discharge or excrete waste material from the body.
meanings.sent1: After eating, the body needs to egest the food waste.
meanings.sent2: Birds egest through their cloaca to remove waste.
meanings.sent3: The digestive system's job is to egest what the body doesn't need.
meanings.sent4: The river egested debris after the heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The garbage truck egested its load at the landfill.

meanings.definition: To expel or eject something from the body.
meanings.sent1: When feeling sick, the body may egest harmful substances.
meanings.sent2: The volcano egested hot lava during the eruption.
meanings.sent3: The machine unexpectedly egested a strange noise.
meanings.sent4: The pressure caused the pipe to egest water forcefully.
meanings.sent5: The sneeze egested a cloud of pollen into the air.
